sen.j: 大治 (日本)5年（1130年）、闘乱事件の罪により兄源光信の土佐国配流が決定すると、光保もこれに連座して兵衛府の任を解かれたが間もなく還任される。
sen.e: In 1130, when his elder brother MINAMOTO no Mitsunobu, accused for the Toran-jiken (Brawling Incident), was sentenced to the deportation to Tosa Province, Mitsuyasu's involvement was also implicated and he was removed from the post of Hyoe-fu, however, he was shortly reappointed to the former position.

sen.j: その後、兄に代わり鳥羽天皇の北面武士を務めるが、娘（土佐局）が法皇の寵妃となったことを契機としてその近臣となる。
sen.e: Afterwards, he took charge of Hokumen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the North side) to Emperor Toba, taking over the elder brother's position, and when his own daughter (Tosa no Tsubone) became the retired Emperor's favorite concubine, he was taken up to be the retired Emperor's courtier.

sen.j: そして、美福門院に近かったことから、その猶子となっていた守仁親王（後の二条天皇）の側近となり、保元の乱に当たっては甥の源光基（土岐氏の祖）と共に後白河天皇方に参加して勝利する。
sen.e: As he had a close contact with Empress Bifukumon-in, he became a close adviser of her adopted son Imperial Prince Morihito(later Emperor Nijo), and during the Hogen Disturbance, he took part in the Emperor Goshirakawa's side together with his nephew MINAMOTO no Mitsumoto (the first generation of the Toki clan), and wan the battle.

sen.j: 乱の後、即位した二条天皇の親政派と退位した後白河天皇の院政派が対立を生じると、光保はかねてからの関係により終始前者の側に立って行動する。
sen.e: After the disturbance, when the conflict set up between the supporters of the enthroned Emperor Nijo's new government and those of the cloister government of Retired Emperor Goshirakawa, Mitsuyasu acted consistently in support of the former side, respecting the relationship so far.

sen.j: 信頼方に味方する理由を失った光保一党は動揺初め陽明門の守備に付くが、最終的には寝返って平清盛方に加勢した。
sen.e: Mitsuyasu and his soldiers got frustrated, having lost their cause to support the Nobuyori's camp, and although they took charge of guarding the Yomei-mon Gate at the beginning, finally they switched sides and went over to the TAIRA no Kiyomori's camp.

sen.j: このため乱の直後は処罰を免れるが、二条親政派の排除を意図した後白河によって、引き続きその立場を狙われることとなる。
sen.e: For this, Mitsuyasu was exempted from the punishment for a while after the disturbance, however, targeted by Retired Emperor Goshirakawa who was trying to exclude all the followers of Emperor Nijo's government, he had to live an precarious situation.
